meanings.definition: The quality of being reliable or trustworthy.
meanings.sent1: Her dependablenesses in completing tasks on time earned her a promotion.
meanings.sent2: I appreciate the dependablenesses of my car, which never breaks down unexpectedly.
meanings.sent3: The dependablenesses of the weather forecast were put to the test when it suddenly started snowing in summer.
meanings.sent4: His dependablenesses in keeping secrets was like a sturdy lock that never failed to protect confidential information.
meanings.sent5: The dependablenesses of the old lighthouse guided ships safely through the stormy night.

meanings.definition: The state of being able to be counted on or relied upon.
meanings.sent1: The team's success was due to the dependablenesses of each member to fulfill their roles.
meanings.sent2: In times of crisis, the dependablenesses of friends become truly evident.
meanings.sent3: The dependablenesses of the alarm clock were questioned when it failed to ring on Monday morning.
meanings.sent4: Her dependablenesses in always being there for her friends was like a comforting blanket on a cold night.
meanings.sent5: The dependablenesses of the bridge held strong even during the fiercest storms.
